summary.para: The HasDialog method determines if the specified dialog box exists in the driver.

param.name: iDialog
param.para: Desired dialog box. This is a member of the enumeration.

returns.para: Returns S_OK if the driver contains the dialog box or S_FALSE otherwise.

remarks.para: This method calls the Video for Windows videoDialog function to query for the existence of the appropriate dialog box.

summary.para: The SendDriverMessage method sends a driver-specific message.

param.name: iDialog
param.para: Handle of the driver dialog box. This is a member of the enumeration.

param.name: uMsg
param.para: Message to send to the driver.

returns.para: Return value varies depending on the implementation within each driver.

remarks.para: You should never need to use this method. This method can send any private message to the capture driver. Behavior might be undetermined in response to arbitrary messages; use this method at your own risk.
This method calls the Video for Windows videoMessage function to send the driver message.

summary.para: The ShowDialog method displays the specified VFW dialog box.

param.name: iDialog
param.para: Dialog box to display. This is a member of the enumeration.

param.name: hwnd
param.para: Handle of the dialog box's parent window.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include the following.

description.para: Could not reconnect with the new format.
The filter graph is not stopped.

remarks.para: Stop the filter graph before calling this method. Otherwise, the method fails and returns VFW_E_NOT_STOPPED.

The Video Format dialog (VfwCaptureDialog_Format) may change the video format. If so, the method tries to reconnect the capture filter. If the downstream filter rejects the new format, the method returns VFW_E_CANNOT_CONNECT.

summary.para: The IAMVfwCaptureDialogs interface displays a dialog box provided by a Video for Windows (VFW) capture driver.
The VFW Capture filter implements this interface. Applications can use it to display one of the three dialog boxes (Source, Format, or Display) provided by VFW capture drivers.
